alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 1:44AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream and urban flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Anderson County, especially locations in and around Palestine. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The heaviest rain will move southeast of the area within the next hour or two, but light to moderate rain will continue for several more hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palestine, Elkhart, Montalba, Brushy Creek, Crystal Lake, Cedar Creek, Broom City, Neches, Tucker, Slocum, Johnson, Salmon, Pert, Todd City, Redtown, Denson Spring, Mound City, Tennessee Colony and Massey Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
